VLIB Function Reference

co-Occurrence Matrix (GLCM)

Introduction and Use Cases

This API calculates co-Occurrence Matrix for various angles for texture analysis.

Specification

Function

Generates multiple co-occurrence matrices as per given inputs. Supported range for input is 8 bit, and for output it is 16 bit. Refer VLIB_coOccurrenceMatrix for more details

Variants

There are two flows of the implementation for this API: one when the user provides a scratch buffer, and the other when the user is not able to provide a scratch buffer. The scratch buffer flow will perform faster.

Inputs


    Parameter              Description                                 DataType
    -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    pInput[]         input data pointer                                (UQ8.0 )
    pCoMatrix[]      Array of pointers for output matrices             (UQ16.0*)
    imageWidth       width of input data, in elements                  (UQ16.0)
    imageHeight      height of input data, in elements                 (UQ16.0)
    imagePitch       stride between input lines, in elements           (UQ16.0)
    loPixelVal       Input values less than or equal to lowPixelVal
                     scaled to 0.                                      (UQ8.0 )
    hiPixelVal       Input values more than or equal to hiPixelVal
                     are scaled to (numLevels -1).                     (UQ8.0 )
    numLevels        The range [lowPixelVal hiPixelVal] is divided
                     into numLevels equal width bins and values in a
                     bin get mapped to a single gray level.            (UQ16.0 )
    numOffsets       Number of  directions for which out matrix is
                     needed.                                           (UQ8.0 )
    rowOffsets       Pointer for the offsets in Y direction for pixel
                     in interest and neighbor pixel.                   (SQ8.0 )
    colOffsets       Pointer for the offsets in X direction for pixel
                     in interest and neighbor pixel.                   (SQ8.0 )
    scratch          Pointer to scratch area. This is not mandatory
                     input. Application can provide this value as NULL,
                     if scratch memory can not be provided. Cycle
                     consumed will be lesser when scratch buffer is
                     provided. Scratch buffer size need to be
                     8*numLevels*numLevels, when it is provided. API
                     checks the value of this argument against NULL,
                     and accordingly appropriate flow chosen.          (UQ8.0* )

Outputs

    Returns VLIB Error Status, and writes co-OccurenceMatrix data at output pointers(pCoMatrix)

APIS

  • VLIB_coOccurrenceMatrix

Notes

Faster performance is possible when a scratch buffer is provided by the application. Extra boost in performance can be achieved if (( hiPixelVal - lowPixelVal +1)/ numLevel) is a positive power of 2

References

  1. Robert M Haralick, K Shanmugam, Its'hak Dinstein (1973). "Textural Features for Image Classification". IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics. SMC-3 (6): 610-621.
